lessons.japanese: 君の主張は、ぼくの頑固親父のと同じく納得できない。
lessons.english: Your argument is not any more convincing than that of my stubborn father.

lessons.japanese: 頑固になればなるほど独立するよ。
lessons.english: The more stubborn you are, the more isolated you become.

lessons.japanese: 頑固になればなるほど孤立するよ。
lessons.english: If it becomes stubborn indeed it stands alone.

lessons.japanese: 頑固にならず、人と仲良くすることです。
lessons.english: You should be friendly rather than stubborn.
I've got my stubbornness from my father.

lessons.japanese: メアリーはとても頑固で、謝ることを知らない。
lessons.english: Mary is too stubborn to apologize.

lessons.japanese: あなたって本当に頑固ね。
lessons.english: You're so set in your ways!

lessons.japanese: 彼女の頑固な性格を考慮に入れるべきだよ。
lessons.english: You should reckon with her obstinate character.

lessons.japanese: 彼は年を取るに連れていっそう頑固になった。
lessons.english: As he grew older, he became more obstinate.

lessons.japanese: 彼は正直であるが頑固だ。
彼は自分の意見を頑固に主張した。
lessons.english: He stubbornly persisted in his opinion.

lessons.japanese: 彼は私が今まで会ったうちで一番頑固な子供だ。
lessons.english: He is the most obstinate child I have ever seen.

lessons.japanese: 彼は歳を取るにつれて次第に頑固になった。
lessons.english: He became more obstinate as he grew older.
